item.title: How to Feed a Hungry WISP
item.description:
By: John Shepler The United States is extensively wired, except in remote areas like farms, rural homes, businesses outside city limits, new developments, and some industrial parks. While universal service often provides phone access, broadband internet is less certain. This is where Wireless Internet Service Providers (WISPs) come in. Why WISPs? WISPs function like cell phone providers but focus on high-speed internet. Unlike 4G cellular data, which has low usage limits, WISPs offer generous data allowances similar to cable, telco, or fiber optic services...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-to-feed-a-hungry-wisp/

item.title: Business Internet Service For Everyone
item.description:
By: John Shepler In contrast to consumer internet access, business internet service has a history of being overly expensive and difficult to obtain, particularly in less populated areas. This perception largely stems from when traditional telephone companies held a monopoly on internet service, resulting in limited choices and exorbitant prices. Thankfully, today’s deregulated market offers a different reality. Any business requiring an internet connection can now get one at budget-friendly prices...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/business-internet-service-for-everyone/
